input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
The name of the poolconfiguartion file name. If this parameter is omitted /etc/pooladm.conf will be used.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[pool configuration filename]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/poolcfg -c 'info' $[pool configuration filename]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[pool configuration filename]')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/poolcfg -c 'info'</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: This process executes the poolcfg "info" sub command to return the configuration for the resource pool.
